The stay was odd. Larry greeted us immediately and showed us around and told us about "local" attractions. Very kind. There was no wifi on the property that we could access so we had to use our 1 bar cell signal to look them up, only to find out they were mostly 1 to 2 hours away. That's ok because we really just wanted a quiet weekend.
There is a small town about 25 minutes away with a couple restaurants and bars and several Family Dollars within 15 minutes. There was also a winery up the road, 35 minutes, with delicious food and decent wine. There isn't much hiking nearby.
The building you stay in is a studio. It's 'cozy' and the bathroom walls don't go to the ceiling. The barn door on the bathroom doesn't stay shut and your knees will touch when on the toilet. The back deck is the same square footage as the cabin and an overall nice area. Unfortunately there isn't much privacy. Most seats are in view of the owner's kitchen and public areas. Also, there is no way to lock the cabin when you leave for the day.
The dogs are both very friendly and sweet. However, they are large and one will jump on you and pee on your car. My back got scratched and my tires were marked each morning. They also stay outside at night and woke us up 3 times over 2 nights.
The breakfast advertised is a delicious muffin. It's not really breakfast, but I'm not mad; it was clutch.
What else... There's a very short walking trail that leads to a very old, 1800s graveyard and there's fresh sod in the back (we saw and heard it being put in Saturday morning). I found a roach in the sink, but you are in the woods...
We won't be back, but if you need a few days of relative quiet and solitude, go for it!
